N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.10 - Cessation of need for restricted license

State Regulations
(a) If a person has been issued a restricted
license and thereafter the employment, medical treatment or education which
forms the basis upon which such license was issued terminates and the person
becomes unemployed, discontinues his or her medical treatment or discontinues
his or her education, the restricted license must be surrendered to the issuing
office of the department which issued the license within three days of such
termination of employment or education. In such a situation, the period of time
during which the person validly held such restricted license shall be credited
towards compliance with the revocation or suspension order which formed the
basis for the issuance of the restricted license. (b) If a person has been issued a restricted
license and thereafter the employment or education or medical treatment which
forms the basis upon which such license was issued terminates and the person
becomes unemployed or discontinues his or her education or discontinues his or
her medical treatment, and the restricted license has been surrendered in
accordance with subdivision (a) of this section, and the person becomes
reemployed, or reenrolls in an educational program or requires further medical
treatment and demonstrates a need for a restricted license in conjunction with
such employment, education or medical treatment, the restricted license, properly amended, may be reissued to such person upon his or her application to
the issuing office of the department to which such license was surrendered
without payment of any additional fee. (c) The provisions of this section shall not
apply to a situation in which the employment or education or medical treatment
upon the issuance of a restricted license was based is terminated but other
employment or education or medical treatment which would support the issuance
of a restricted license is obtained within three days of the termination of the
previous employment or education. In such case, the licensee shall apply for an
amended restricted license at the appropriate issuing office of the
department. Notes
